event.title: begins with the opening of the copper mine "El Cobre" by José Antonio Moreno in 1850

data.event: The history of Taltal begins with the opening of the copper mine "El Cobre" by José Antonio Moreno in 1850 about 20 kilometers north of Taltal.
In 1855 Moreno expanded his operations to include Taltal.
The discovery of copper in 1858 on nearby Mount Cachiyuyal increased pressure on the port, which had to utilize customs officials from Copiapo.

event.title: was granted by decree on 12 July 1858

data.event: So Moreno requested official recognition of the port which was granted by decree on 12 July 1858.
However, the real boom began in 1876 with the opening of nitrate mines, in particular potassium nitrate.
In 1879, the first nitrates were shipped from the area.
In 1882 a railway was completed from Cachinal de la Sierra and other nitrate mining sites.
It was built by the "Taltal Railway Company", a British company, sold to private investors in 1954, and dismantled in 1970 due to the end of nitrate mining.
